intro: Connarus rigidus, commonly known as the rigid connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems that become increasingly rigid with age. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within forests. Connarus rigidus is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
